servinfo.title: DTC P2227/ P2228 / P2229: Barometric Pressure Circuit Malfunction
servinfo.subtitle: DTC P2227: Barometric Pressure Circuit Range / Performance
DTC P2228: Barometric Pressure Circuit Low
DTC P2229: Barometric Pressure Circuit High

servinfosub.title: System Description
servinfosub.ptxt: Barometric pressure sensor is installed in ECM.

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

ptxt.emph: DTC P2227: Barometric Pressure Circuit Range / Performance

entry.ptxt: Difference between measured barometric pressure and estimated barometric pressure based on MAP is more than 25.3 kPa at engine start.
(2 driving cycle detection logic, monitoring once per driving cycle)

ptxt.emph: DTC P2228: Barometric Pressure Circuit Low

entry.ptxt: Barometric pressure sensor voltage is less than 0.1 V for 19 seconds or longer.

ptxt.emph: DTC P2229: Barometric Pressure Circuit High

entry.ptxt: Barometric pressure sensor voltage is more than 5.1 V for 19 seconds or longer.

attention3.ptxt: Check to make sure that the following conditions are satisfied when using this “DTC Confirmation Procedure”.

item.ptxt: Intake air temperature: between –10 °C and 45 °C (14 °F and 113 °F)
Engine coolant temperature: between –10 °C and 110 °C (14 °F and 230 °F)
The following DTCs are not detected: CMP sensor, TP sensor and IAC system

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC by using scan tool if any.
Check DTC and pending DTC by using scan tool.
With ignition switch OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC by using scan tool if any.
Start engine and run it for 10 sec.
Check DTC and pending DTC by using scan tool.

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check .
Substitute a known good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Check MAP sensor and its circuit referring to DTC P0107 / P0108: Manifold Absolute Pressure Sensor Circuit Low / High Input .

action.ptxt: Substitute a known good ECM and recheck.
